The world population would grow exponentially due to increased lifespan and reduced mortality rates. This could lead to resource depletion, environmental destruction, and overpopulation.
The medical industry would become obsolete as there would be no diseases to treat. This could lead to a shift in the job market, with healthcare workers transitioning to other fields.
People would have more time to focus on personal pursuits and hobbies, leading to increased creativity and innovation.
Society would have to re-evaluate its priorities and values, as the concept of suffering and illness would no longer be a driving force.

The global economy would undergo a significant shift, as industries such as pharmaceuticals and medical equipment would become obsolete. New industries would need to emerge to replace them, leading to job creation and economic growth.
